image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason looks off camera.

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason has been on leave with pay for almost a year while he faced allegations of family violence, but the Tasmanian government appears to have no mechanism to suspend or remove him, even after his guilty verdict.Â

title.children: Judge guilty of causing concussion and bruising to a woman, but will remain on a $500,000 salary

image.altText: Gregory Geason on mobile phone outside court.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian Supreme Court judge is found guilty of one charge each of assault and emotional abuse or intimidation.

title.children: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge found guilty of assault

image.altText: A faded car sticker that reads King Island: Think Buy Live Local

props.synopsis: Despite a high price tag, the Tasmanian Freight Equalisation Scheme is just not working the way it should.

title.children: This costly scheme helps small businesses, so why has almost no one on King Island got a good thing to say about it?

image.altText: Penny Wong wears a maroon blazer as she speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Foreign Minister said she didn't believe "we gain anything by shouting each other down" after being forced to stop her speech multiple times.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protesters shout down Penny Wong as she delivers speech in Tasmania

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: Hobart's status as the gateway to Antarctica has been secured after the federal government agreed to fund a new home port for Australia's icebreaker, but the Tasmanian government will be on the hook for the cost of a refuelling solution â€” something which has been a problem of late.

title.children: Port funding announced to secure Hobart as 'gateway to Antarctica'

image.altText: Photos of a bus station.

props.synopsis: A mayor and Tasmanian government department are at odds over how a bus interchange could be "ticked off" despite not being fit-for-purpose, with the corner too tight for buses to turn.

title.children: Million-dollar bus interchange sitting unused 10 months later after being built too tight for buses to turn

image.altText: Guy BarnettÂ stands in front of a big painting and smiles.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has a new deputy premier, as an early morning meeting of the Liberal Party elects minister Guy Barnett to the role in the wake of Michael Ferguson's departure from the cabinet for the backbench.

title.children: Guy Barnett elected unopposed as Tasmania's deputy premier

image.altText: An artist's impression of a new ferry wharf

props.synopsis: A trial passenger service between Hobart and Bellerive has proven so successful that a permanent ferry terminal is being proposed.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Indoor waiting area, bicycle storage part of newly released designs for upgraded Bellerive ferry wharf

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and flags walk in a protest rally.

props.synopsis: Staff at the Australian National University in Canberra have been asked to forgo an agreed pay rise amid efforts to get the university's budget under control.

title.children: 'I know this is a big ask': ANU staff urged to forgo agreed pay rise to keep university afloat

image.altText: Five beers are held up as people cheers

props.synopsis: Prague has banned night-time pub crawls organised by travel agencies. Is this the end of the stag do?

title.children: World's thirstiest nation bans organised night-time pub crawls

image.altText: A man's hand encloses an orange ball while blood flows from a needle and tube in his forearm.

props.synopsis: Josh Blizzard has a genetic condition called haemochromatosis, where his body absorbs too much iron. The prescribed treatment is to regularly remove blood, and the good news is it's safe for donation.

title.children: Tens of thousands of '100 per cent safe' bags of blood are being binned instead of donated

image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr stands on a stage speaking behind a podium.

props.synopsis: The ACT chief minister says it was a mistake to appoint Walter Sofronoff to head an inquiry into the trial of Bruce Lehrmann.Â

title.children: Barr says Sofronoff's appointment to board of inquiry a 'mistake'

image.altText: A sign that says 24/7 banking with a Westpac logo next to it.

props.synopsis: Customers with Westpac and St George have experienced difficulties accessing their internet banking for the third day in a row. Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the government has been in contact with the bank.

title.children: 'Really concerning': Treasurer responds to Westpac outages

image.altText: A teenage boy's hands on a table. He is fidgeting, wrapping fingers around his thumb.

props.synopsis: The boy, who was incarcerated in Perth's Banksia Hill Detention Centre and faced 36 criminal charges, has been released from custody without further penalties. A magistrate described him as WA's "most vulnerable child".

title.children: 'State's most vulnerable child': 11yo WA boy released after a total 77 days in custody

image.altText: Two young men smile for the camera on the red carpet for the 2019 Logies.

props.synopsis: Radio host, TV star and podcaster Hamish Blake on his secret fitness training, taking up golf, the "barbs that stick in your heart" when raising children, and other parenting challenges.

title.children: 'A fight that's ultimately futile': Hamish Blake on facing his own mortality in his home gym

image.altText: A local resident and a rescuer stand on debris of a building.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president tells politicians his plan contains five main points that rely on Kyiv's allies, including an unconditional invitation to join NATO and specific weapons support.

title.children: Zelenskyy unveils victory plan as Russia reports capture of two Ukrainian villages

image.altText: A plane with 'Batik' branding begins its take-off from the runway.

props.synopsis: The airline says it will reinstate the Canberra to Denpasar services when market conditions are more conductive.Â

title.children: Batik Air suspends flights indefinitely between Canberra and Bali four months after they started

image.altText: Young Caucasian man taking a self portrait on a couch wearing a brown cap, a black singlet and an orange scarf.

props.synopsis: Jake Bradford has not been seen since his mother reported him missing more than 600 days ago. Police found what they suspect to be human remains during a search of the tiny Victorian town of Dollar.

title.children: Police uncover remains in search for allegedly murdered 21yo Victorian man

image.altText: Perth Stadium

props.synopsis: Perth will host the first Ashes Test of the 2025/26 season, handing the new Perth Stadium its first-ever men's Ashes Test.

title.children: Perth to host series opener in 43-year first as Ashes dates are locked in

image.altText: Lisa Marie Presley at the Cartier Flagship Store for a special party to unveil the book "Cartier: Untamed".

props.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died before she had the chance to finish her memoir, From Here To The Great Unknown. Per her wishes, her eldest daughter Riley Keough helped it make its way into the world.

title.children: Lisa Marie Presley's posthumous memoir is a sad, shocking and tender look at the price paid for fame

image.altText: Ollie Olsen in a 1991 promo shot for his project Third Eye.

props.synopsis: Ian 'Ollie' Olsen, a significant figure in Australia's post-punk scene and a pioneer in experimental electronic music, has died following a lengthy illness.

title.children: Ollie Olsen, celebrated musician and Michael Hutchence collaborator, dies age 66

image.altText: Aerial view of beach, on sunny day with homes and escarpment in the background

props.synopsis: A judge has ruled a man convicted of murdering a child when he was a teenager "freely and voluntarily" interacted with a woman and her toddler at the beach.

title.children: Murderer breached supervision order by approaching woman and child at NSW beach

image.altText: Jess lies on the grass laughing.

props.synopsis: Jess Cerro â€” aka the singer-songwriter Montaigne â€” didn't study music in school because the tuition was expensive, but taught themselves guitar and pursued music anyway.

title.children: For years Montaigne assumed their savings were taken care of. Then they realised 'the truth' about their finances

image.altText: man with tower in bakground

props.synopsis: Around 60,000 devices including mobile phones, medical devices and alarms will not work beyond October 28 when Optus and Telstra shut down their 3G networks and the government is urging people to be prepared.Â

title.children: Two weeks from Australia's 3G shutdown, tens of thousands of devices still need updating

image.altText: Kingsley Dixon sits on a hill of orange brown rubble, in front of a horizon of mined land.

props.synopsis: In the world's only jarrah forests a US aluminium giant has been mining bauxite for 60 years. Scientists say the damage may be permanent.

title.children: The world's only jarrah forests have been mined for 60 years. The damage may be permanent

image.altText: Medibank Private

props.synopsis: New government figures show the number of people with top-level gold health insurance coverage has dropped by more than 400,000 between December 2020 and the end of last year.

title.children: Warnings issued to those downgrading health insurance

image.altText: An older woman with short grey hair and rounded glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: The federal government's threat to ban excessive debit card surcharges by 2026 has been welcomed by customers and small businesses who have been hit with higher costs for years â€” but not everyone is on board.

title.children: 'I was quite shocked': Convenience almost cost one woman $150 in card surcharges

image.altText: A close up photo of a man wearing a suit and blue tie.

props.synopsis: The US government warns Israel that if it does not improve access to humanitarian aid in Gaza in the next 30 days, American military funding to the country may be cut.

title.children: White House's $26.7b warning to Israel: Improve aid or we'll cut your military funding

image.altText: A gloved hand holds a black spherical piece of debris.

props.synopsis: Mysterious black spheres washed up on Coogee Beach on Tuesday. The beach has been closed until further notice as Randwick City Council works to safely remove the debris and investigates.

title.children: Sydney's Coogee Beach shut after discovery of mysterious black balls

image.altText: Albanese in a high-vis yellow vest speaks in front of a microphone in front of a green sign

props.synopsis: Household batteries could form part of a plan to make electricity cheaper for low- to middle-income earners before the next election.

title.children: Household battery scheme to form part of Labor's pre-election plan for low- and middle-income earners

image.altText: A man in a suit stands in front of a woman in a pink jacket, two men in suits and a man in a cammo Navy outfit in front of a

props.synopsis: The Henderson shipyard will house a multi-billion-dollar defence precinct for naval shipbuilding and servicing of AUKUS nuclear-powered submarines, creating an industry the state government claims will rival WA's massive resources sector.

title.children: Thousands of jobs set to be created at new Perth defence shipbuilding and submarine maintenance precinct

image.altText: Close up of woman with brown hair tied back has gold framed glasses, with pale skin and brown eyes. She looks ahead solemnly.

props.synopsis: Tayla-Jane Jackson had a late-term abortion in 2023 with the agreement of two doctors. She does not want a private member's bill introduced by Liberal MLC Ben Hood to pass parliament.Â

title.children: 'I would not be able to cope': One of the few women in SA who needed a late-term abortion doesn't agree with changing the laws

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis:
Prior to his equality bill passing the lower house, Sydney MP Alex Greenwich welcomed news that the Liberal member for North Shore, Felicity Wilson, would cross the floor to vote in favour. But he also described her party's stance as "worrying".Â 

Â

title.children: Sydney MP worried about 'right-wing trend' as Coalition rejects conscience vote on equality bill

image.altText: A white and blue coloured "Lufthansa" flight takes off with three other jets from the carrier seen on the tarmac below

props.synopsis: Lufthansa agrees to pay the US federal transport agency its largest-ever penalty issued against an airline for civil rights violations.

title.children: German flag carrier Lufthansa to pay record US penalty over mistreatment of 128 Jewish passengers

image.altText: A family photo of two parents and three young children, against the backdrop of a blue beach.

props.synopsis: Jess Meikle, her husband, their five-year-old twins and four-year-old have embarked on an Australian caravanning extravaganza.

title.children: What's the best age to take your kids on a family gap year?
